class decogo.problem.approx_data.ApproxData(block_model)[source]Â¶

Wrapper class for storing approximation data, i.e. inner points, linearization cuts, valid compact cuts and cells.

  • block_model (BlockModel) â Block model

  • inner_points (InnerPoints) â Stores the inner points

  • linearization_cuts (LinearizationCuts) â Stores linearization cuts (for OA algorithm)

  • compact_cuts (CompactCuts) â Stores valid compact cuts

class decogo.problem.approx_data.LinearizationCuts(block_model)[source]Â¶

This class computes and stores the linearization cuts which are used for OA solver

Parameters

  • block_model (BlockModel) â Block model

  • cuts (dict) â List of linearization cuts

__init__(block_model)[source]Â¶

Constructor method

add_linearization_cuts(y, eps, x=None, block_id=None)[source]Â¶

This method decides for which cases to compute linearization cuts. The cuts are computed with formula \(g(y) + \nabla g(y)^T(x-y) \leq 0\), where \(y\) is a linearization point.

Depending on the input values the cuts are added in the following cases:

  • if x is None, then the cuts are added to active constraint at point y.

  • if x is not None, then the cuts are added only for constraint which are violated at point x and are active at point y

  • if block_id is None, then linearization cuts are added to the all blocks

Parameters

  • y (BlockVector or ndarray) â Linearization point

  • eps (float) â Accuracy for checking if the constraint is active

  • x (BlockVector or ndarray or None) â point of OA solution

  • block_id (int or None) â Block identifier

Returns

Number of new added cuts

Return type

int

compute_and_add_linearization_cut(block_id, j, y)[source]Â¶

Method which computes the linearization cut for nonlinear constraint of the k-th block regarding a reference point y

Parameters

  • block_id (int) â Block identifier

  • j (int) â Nonlinear constraint index

  • y (ndarray) â Reference point

Returns

positive integer, which correspond to the number of added cuts, if all gradient values are ok (and the cut was possible to compute), i.e. no \(\infty\) numbers, 0 - otherwise

Return type

int

class decogo.problem.approx_data.CompactCuts(block_model)[source]Â¶

Class that stores valid compact linear cuts got after solving the subproblems. They are defined with \(a^Tw \leq b\), where \(a, w \in \mathbb{R}^{m+1}, m\) is the number of global linear constraints

Parameters

  • block_model (BlockModel) â Block model

  • cuts (dict) â Cuts stored blockwise as a dictionary with list as values

__init__(block_model)[source]Â¶

Constructor method

Parameters

  • lhs (ndarray) â Left hand side of the constraint

  • relation (str) â Relation of the constraint

  • rhs (float) â Right hand side of the constraint
